intro: Humiria balsamifera var. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved balsamwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. The tree can grow up to 15 meters tall and is valued for its aromatic wood and medicinal properties.
